properties.name: Beli beach
properties.description: Posted by Dsinisa  Beach at the bottom of the beautiful Beli village on the island of Cres. Can get crowded in the summer due to many divers and a small harbour nearby. Take a short walk and explore the smaller but cuter beaches further south.

properties.name: Brbiscica
properties.description: Posted by Dsinisa If you follow a narrow concrete road that takes you from the main road near Brbinj over the hill and down to the south coast of the island you will find a very nice secluded pebbly beach. On the eastern side of the cove you will find an extra: a miniature cove with a beach - perfect for couples or families. A true hidden beach that\'s available by car - what\'s more to ask?

properties.name: Dubovica
properties.description: Posted by DsinisaThe largest beach on the southern coast of the Hvar island. At one side of the beach there is a small village with just a small church and several stone houses. In one of them there is (sort of) a restaurant. Nice.

properties.name: Lubenice beach
properties.description: Posted by Dsinisa  Quite a big beach at the bottom of the charming Lubenice village, on the Cres island. You can reach it by boat, or you can take the walking path which descends from the village down to the beach. (It takes about half an hour to get down, and more than an hour to get up again, it\'s quite steep!) Apart from the fact that the place is becoming popular for tourist boats and ships, this beach is near-perfect.

properties.name: Meli
properties.description: Posted by DsinisaBeatiful hidden beach on Cres island, probably my favourite. If you want to get there, turn east from the main road 7km north of Osor, near the bus stop, where the sign on the opposite side of the road points west for the village Ustrine. From there, a bad macadam road goes through villages Srem and Plat. Important: There are many gates on that road that keep the sheep confined; after you open them and pass through, make sure to close them again in order to prevent the sheep running away and getting lost. After you reach the village Plat, you have to continue on foot for about half an hour. The path will lead you to a tiny harbour. Follow the path for the additional 30m and the hidden Meli lagoon will appear. The beach is truly beautiful, so keep it preserved and clean!

properties.name: Meli nr Punta Kriza
properties.description: Posted by DsinisaIn the Punta Kriza village take the road to the left just before the small church. When you reach the sea, proceed right on the macadam road. After 3km or so you\'ll find plenty space to park on a straight section of the road. From there take one of the forest paths on the right that lead to the nearby sandy coves. The coves form a beautiful sandy shallow lagoon, perfect for children, nudists and having fun in the sea.

properties.name: Milna
properties.description: Posted by DsinisaMilna bay has a beach which is not bad at all, but the fact that it\'s just under the road somewhat ruins the experience plus it gets crowded easily. The good side is that you can take a 10 minute walk to the bigger and nicer beach in Zaglav.

properties.name: Mir
properties.description: Posted by Dsinisa A special place. A rocky beach on the quiet lake Mir (the word "mir" means "peace") in the Telascica nature park on the Dugi otok island. The water is very salty, warm and kinda muddy, but nice to swim in. Can get crowded in the summer, but that should not keep you from visiting this unique place.

properties.name: Mlaska
properties.description: Posted by DsinisaSandy beach with shallow water. Ideal for fun, games, and kids. Situated in the Mlaska Autocamp.

properties.name: Palmizana
properties.description: Posted by DsinisaSunny beach on the Pakleni islands nearby Hvar town. Not so big and quite crowded in summer. Wild natural atmosphere partly ruined by the yachtsmen. Somewhat trendy.

properties.name: Paradise beach
properties.description: Posted by Dsinisa  Due to the shallow sea level, this huge beach is perfect for inferior swimmers, children and elderly people. Near the beach there is San Marino hotels village and the biggest camping on the island, as well as many private apartments to rent. Sandy shallow waters are long and it takes about 500m until the sea comes half the waist of an adult. This beach gets quite crowded in summer.

properties.name: Picugi pyramids
properties.description: Posted by DsinisaStrange pyramid-like hills in Picugi, near Porec, Croatia. On each of the hills there is a ruin of some kind. Possibly ritual sites? Needs to be explored.

properties.name: Porat
properties.description: Posted by DsinisaThis beautiful sandy beach on the small island of Bisevo near Vis should not be missed. Clear water and the fact that it\'s not too popular make it one of the best. You can get food and drinks there too. To get there take a boat trip from the island of Vis which will also take you to the famous Blue cave on the other side of Bisevo.

properties.name: Pupnatska luka
properties.description: Posted by DsinisaThis beach is quite popular for those who don\'t mind the bad roads which lead to it. (When you come from the Pupnat village, do not take the eastern macadam road down to the cove, since the western one is much better.) The beach is quite big and made of pebbles and round stones of all sizes. There\'s a small bar down on the beach. I guess when the roads get better, this beach could get really crowded.

properties.name: Rucica
properties.description: Posted by DsinisaA hidden beach near the village Metajna on the island of Pag, Croatia. Extraordinary moon-like surroundings make it really special.

properties.name: Sakarun
properties.description: Posted by Dsinisa Definitely one of the most beautiful beaches on the Adriatic coast. A large sandy beach with pebbly coast, with shade available and even a nice beach bar. This place is (as expected) quite popular with the yachting people, but fortunately boats are not allowed to get too close, which makes this place great for any activity: swimming, playing games, fooling around... It can get busy around here, but since the beach is huge (for Adriatic standards), it never feels crowded. There\'s even a smaller and less popular beach a short walk to the south. A great place.

properties.name: Srebrna
properties.description: Posted by DsinisaBeautiful midsize pebbly beach amidst nice rocky coastline, naturally clean and with plenty of shade. One of my favorites. Almost at the end of the road to the village Rukavac turn right (you\'ll see a sign) and after a short ride you will reach a macadam parking place. Park there and take a short walk down the path to the right.

properties.name: Stiniva
properties.description: Posted by DsinisaThis is an absolute must-see. The beach itself is small, pebbly and in fact not so convenient, but the entire scenery is so special and exotic it shouldn\'t be missed. The easy way to get there is by boat, but you can reach it on foot too. On the main road Komiza-Vis follow the signs to Marine Zemlje village (it\'s better to enter the village from the western road) and eventually you\'ll reach a small parking lot. Park there and take a path down to the cove. The path is short but quite difficult and steep (put some trekking shoes on!), but you won\'t be disappointed once you get down: the cove (inside a cove) is enclosed with high rocky "walls" with only a narrow entrance from the sea. On this famous beach you\'ll even find a small bar/restaurant.

properties.name: Stoncica
properties.description: Posted by DsinisaEasy to find and therefore one of the most popular beaches on Vis. Rather small, but packed with a tiny beach bar, a restaurant and a beach volley field. In high season the cove gets crowded with yachts which somewhat ruins the experience. The seabed is sandy which makes it perfect for kids. To get there follow the sign on the Vis-Milna road, park at the end of the road and take a 5 minute walk down the path to the beach.

properties.name: Strasko
properties.description: Posted by Dsinisa Strasko is one of the biggest and nicest campings on the Adriatic coast, located 2 km south-east from Novalja. The beach in textile part is 700m long and covered with pebbles, with a sandy sea bottom. The beach on the naturist side is rocky and arranged with platforms, surrounded by oak forest.

properties.name: Sv. Nedjelja
properties.description: Posted by DsinisaTiny sandy beach (not really a sand, but close enough). Quite exotic-looking and cute. It can be pretty crowded in high season. Try the famous wines in the village of Sv. Nedjelja.

properties.name: Vaja
properties.description: Posted by DsinisaA very nice hidden beach near Racisce on the northern coast of the Korcula island. Go straight through the village Racisce and proceed to the west. The road goes uphill and down again until it ends with a tiny macadam parking area. From there take the short path down the cliff to the beach.

properties.name: Vela Przina
properties.description: Posted by DsinisaThis could easily be the most popular beach on the island, filled with tourists and locals. It\'s easy to find, close to Lumbarda, which is close to Korcula town. The beach gets very crowded in summer so if you like sandy beaches hurry up to take good spot as early as possible. There is an open-air cafe/restaurant right on the beach for simple food and refreshments.

properties.name: Zaglav
properties.description: Posted by DsinisaNice sandy beach, quite big, somewhat popular. Very nice for children or playing games in the water. You can get there from Milna beach (just take a path that goes further south along the coast), or from Brguljac village (take a short path from the village at the end of the main road which will take you across the hill). You can get some food and drinks in the small restaurant on the beach.

properties.name: Zitna
properties.description: Posted by DsinisaBeautiful small semi-hidden beach in a small narrow cove on the southern coast of the island, near the village Zavalatica. When you reach the beginning of the village, turn left on every next crossing. Finally, a narrow road will lead you down to the beach. The seabed in the cove is almost entirely made of white sand which makes the sea wonderfully turquoise.

properties.name: Zrce
properties.description: Posted by DsinisaZrce is a long, stretched, white pebbled beach with crystal clear sea, situated near Novalja, on the Pag island, Croatia. The beach has numerous facilities and three popular open-air clubs offering 24h entertainment. Being a party beach, it is extremely popular and can get really crowded.
